nav.tagline: Open data & structured metadata for New Hampshireâ€™s 4,000-foot peaks.

catalog.title: NH48 Peak Catalog
catalog.intro: Browse New Hampshire's forty-eight 4000-footers. Click a peak to view more details. If errors occur, details will appear below. Open API and datasets for New Hampshireâ€™s 4,000-foot mountains.

trailType.out_back_common_or_long_traverse: Out & back - common or long traverse
trailType.out_back_common_or_loop_with_connector_t: Out & back - common or loop with connector trails
trailType.out_back_common_or_small_loop_including_: Out & back - common or small loop including Mt Webster
trailType.out_back_or_loop_with_tom_and_willey: Out & back or loop - with Tom and Willey
trailType.out_back_or_loop_combining_trails: Out & back or loop combining trails

meta.descriptionTemplate: {name} â€“ {elevation} ft high, {prominence} ft prominence, in the {range}. Routes, difficulty, and photos for this 4,000-footer.

trails.title: ğŸ”ï¸ WMNF Trails API Map Tool
trails.subtitle: Open peak, trail, and route data structure for the White Mountains.
trails.intro: White Mountain National Forest â€” compiled by Nate Sobol. Use this as a quick trail finder and completion tracker. Open API and datasets for New Hampshireâ€™s 4,000-foot mountains.

details.title: Trail details
details.empty: Select a trail to view distance, elevation, and OpenStreetMap details.

list.noMatches: No trails found. Try a different search.

about.title: About this list
about.body: NH Tracing, Redlining, and White Mountain Trails all refer to the same collection of trails described in the guidebook. No matter which name you use, youâ€™re working towards the same goal of experiencing these paths.

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.body: This site is not intended for planning or navigation. Trail data may contain minor errors or inaccuracies, and this collection is not the official list (though it includes most of the known trails). Please refer to official sources and use good judgement in the backcountry.

howto.title: How to use
howto.body: Use the green circles to mark a trail as completed. After marking a trail, tap the calendar icon to add a date of completion â€” the date will replace the icon once selected and can be edited by tapping again. Your progress is stored locally in your browser. You can export or import your progress using the buttons below.

info.noProperties: No additional trail properties available yet. Properties will be populated from OpenStreetMap data.
info.loadingProperties: Loading additional trail properties from OpenStreetMap...
info.sourceNote: Information sourced from OpenStreetMap where available.

trails.confirmClear: Are you sure you want to clear all progress?
trails.alertLoadFail: Unable to load trail data. Please ensure you have internet connectivity and try refreshing the page.

map.attribution: Map data: © OpenStreetMap contributors, SRTM | Map style: © OpenTopoMap (CC-BY-SA)
